channel.title: Gamblers Hall of Fame Las Vegas on Vintage Vegas

item.title: Remembering the Gamblers Hall of Fame: A Fleeting Legend of Vintage Las Vegas
item.description:
A Different Kind of Fame on Fremont Street

Downtown Las Vegas, especially Fremont Street, has always been a breeding ground for unique and often short-lived themed casinos. But few were as ambitious, or as quickly forgotten, as the Gamblers Hall of Fame. Opened in 1974 at 32 Fremont Street, taking over the Carousel Casinoâ€™s former space, it wasn’t just a place to wager; it was intended to be a shrine to the legends of poker and gaming.
